Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments, including 1886,0401.1087) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery krater; interior reserved; exterior; cream slip; ridge at base of neck with zone of tongues below, some with added red; broad dividing band with traces of added red and white between zone of tongues and main decorative field: part of sphinx and goose to left, with small part of further figure at left break; filling ornaments: blobs and roughly drawn rosettes; red patches on head of sphinx, on neck and on alternate sections of wing of goose and on rosettes; incision used for part of the outline and for details of sphinx, goose and rosettes.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.518)
